message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with the performance of machine learning classifiers on discriminating between similar languages and language varieties. It also explores the progress made between two editions of the Discriminating between Similar Languages (DSL) shared task, which is a common topic in the field of natural language processing. 

It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it involves the use of machine learning classifiers to solve a language discrimination problem. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it discusses the challenges of language discrimination and the implications of such technology on society. 

Finally, it could be classified under cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as it involves the analysis of performance metrics and learning curves to understand the effectiveness of machine learning classifiers in language discrimination.
